Comment: The DNC is to blame as he wasn’t calling the shots for awhile. I truly cannot forgive the DNC and his admin for gaslighting America about his condition. Anyone who has cared for or witnessed an elder succumb to dementia knew what they were looking at even before the debate. My extended family of mixed politics discussed how he was mimicking our late grandfather who descended down the same tragic health path. I was shocked, pissed, and ultimately relieved that they were essentially capitulating by agreeing to a debate vs Trump because I knew what was going to happen. I was pissed because they were knowingly punting on a prayer that Biden would have a “good night”. Even more pissed when DNC heads tried to continue the farce by saying “oh he just had a bad debate night.” Imagine the global fallout of another 4 years of a lame duck President. We’d be getting walked around by the rest of the world, especially the rogue super powers and groups who fully took advantage of a weak President/admin. I made a lot of money arbitraging betting odds against Biden, for Kamala, and ultimately piling in on election night for Trump to win. Was free money to anyone paying attention. DNC needs a restructuring desperately and admitting to their fuckup with Biden, along with actually letting authentic candidates to be elected, would be a good start.

Comment: Biden didn't remake the country in his image because he 1) doesn't have an image, he is a vessel for neoliberalism and 2) was a senile old man for most of his term.    I agree about approval ratings, and I don't think they really matter for anyone.  Biden spent most of his term deep underwater and the Democrats did just fine in his midterm.  Until something changes I don't think *any* president for the foreseeable future is going to have a positive approval rating for any appreciable amount of time.    But it's not just the approval number I am pointing to.  By the midterms shelves are going to be empty and everything is going to cost 25% more.  Americans are very aware of their wallets right now, and outside of a small contingent the Republican voter base is not actually prepared for the amount of inflation that Trump is going to inflict with tariffs in the coming months.  You're right, the Democrats have spent the months since the election left-bashing and trying to tell everyone it's not their fault.  That's why it's going to be the least deserved majority in the history of American electoral politics.  They've presented nothing.
